author: Shari Savage
title: Archbishop Claims Obama Pressured Pope Benedict to Resign
text:
Obama has Over 12 People in a D.C. Office to “Keep Tabs” on Trump 
The pope’s resignation statement cited concerns for “strength of mind and body,” but no further elaboration was given. Benedict’s leave was swift and nearly silent. 
No sooner had conservative Benedict been replaced by liberal Pope Francis than concerned observers began to seek the truth about Benedict’s historic resignation. 
Archibishop Negri, a conservative church leader who retired in February shortly after turning 75, points out the some Catholic groups “have asked President Trump to open a commission of inquiry to investigate whether the administration of Barack Obama exerted pressure on Benedict,” and maintains that the connection is more than coincidental. In a Jan. 20 open letter to President Donald Trump, the Catholic newspaper The Remnant, a mouthpiece for Catholic traditionalists still opposed to the sweeping church reforms instituted by the Second Vatican Council of the early 1960s, asked the Trump administration to investigate political manipulation of the papacy. 
The letter specifically references former Hillary Clinton campaign manager John Podesta’s emails , published by WikiLeaks, which suggest a planned attack on conservative Catholics using front organizations that Podesta founded specifically for this purpose. 
Obama is a president whose last Christmas card didn’t mention either Christmas or Christ. For a president so bent on not offending all the non-Christians out there, it’s a bit odd he allegedly was so interested in the inner workings of the Catholic Church. 
If an investigation proves these allegations from church insiders to be true, the fallout for both the former Obama administration, already hanging by a thin credibility thread, will be huge. And it won’t do the papacy any good either. Advertisement - story continues below
